title: How to Make an Outdoor Hideout

steps.headline: Find a place to build your hideout.
steps.description: Look around for a good, hidden area to build your hideout in.

steps.headline: Look around for materials to build your hideout with.
steps.description: This could be anything, like wooden boards, branches, and rocks. Another suggestion is to make a cave or dig a hole in snow, for example.

steps.headline: Start building your hideout.
steps.description: You'll probably want to make it big enough for 2-4 people and make some room for extra items.

steps.headline: Cover your hideout so no one will be able to find it or see it.
steps.description: You could cover your hideout with things like leaves or twigs to make it seem like  other people think that there's nothing there.

steps.headline: Decorate your hideout to make it more fun and useful.
steps.description: You could bring in things like lawn chairs for people to sit in, a snack drawer, or pillows and a soft blanket for people to lay on.

steps.headline: Make a good door.
steps.description: You'll need to make a good door to keep people out whenever you leave your hideout. Again, things found in nature work perfect. You could also improvise by getting a wood board and gluing things on it like bark, leaves, or twigs to give it a more of a nature look.

steps.headline: Have some good rules so everyone there knows what's good and what's bad.
steps.description: This might be a secret hideout for you and your friends, but remember, safety first.
